description:
Yeah, the Ferry Building is kind of touristy, but being on the edge of the Financial District, it is worth walking over there for lunch occasionally. I have stopped by the Golden Gate Meat Company a few times to grab a sandwich and then eat out back on the pier.

This last visit was with the office crew. I got the Hot Pastrami & Dijon sandwich. For $9, it was a wonderful sandwich. Now, as I was feeling good about the deal I got on the sandwich, another in our group said that she got a half a chicken for $5. It was a small chicken, but it was enough for her to eat half and take half home for dinner. Now THAT is a good deal. Check that one out when you get there.
author: Marvin M.

description:
Been here twice now.  Food: mediocre. Service: Surly and unresponsive.  Clearly a tourist trap that hires at minimum wage and puts no value on the customer experience.  Order breakfast today.  
"Can I get a slice of tomato with that and no onions, please?"  
"No, we don't do that". 
"But there is a tomato right there".   
"It only comes with capers and onions".
"Ok, no onions please" 
puts onions on and hands me the food.  "No onions please". Starts throw away food.  
"Never mind I pick them off". Picks some off for me.

I can put up with bad attitude, but only if the food is great. It was not
author: Jack N.

description:
Yesterday my fiancé and I came to check out the Ferry Building Marketplace and Saturday Farmer's Market. It looks like a super fun place, but I was hangry and the Marketplace was crowded af. We don't do crowds and just wanted some food, so we came to Golden Gate because it had one of the shortest lines. 

I think we must have just gotten lucky on that, because I can't imagine this spot would have a short line normally! We each got the Breakfast Sandwich (egg, cheddar cheese, and bacon on a kaiser roll; my fiancé got the ultimate version with hash browns), which really isn't something I would typically order. I thought I didn't really like that kind of thing, but at least at this place, I was totally wrong :) 

Would definitely recommend this spot if you're checking out the Marketplace! And would recommend the spicy ketchup with your sandwich lol.
author: Ashley D.

description: Really loved their dry chorizo that they make in house! I had a friendly worker help me choose some snack sticks out. The Peppered NY Kobe nuggets were good, too but I'd get the chorizo again. I still have some Nueskes sticks I got there I need to try. Cant wait to try their other items.
author: Oanh L.

description:
Hot pastrami Dijon sandwich was da bomb.

Pork bbq sandwich was ok.
Mac n cheese was ok.
author: Kim l.

description: Extremely poor customer service!! The cashier with the short hair is so RUDE. She has a very rude tone when speaking and asking what you want and she just looks so angry. &&& the food isn't even that great. I got the chicken pot pie and the chicken was still pink inside and overall the pie did not taste good. The only bright side is that, they are inexpensive BUT I don't mind paying a bit more somewhere else and receive better customer service and tastier food.
author: Jessica S.

description: Word on the street is they've got some great salmon lox bagels here. Unfortunately I came by 11am on a Wednesday and they were all sold out. The owner suggested calling in early to reserve one of their Salmon lox bagels. Totally going to do that in the future!
author: Murray N.

description:
I picked up a ribeye here for a special homecooked dinner but it turned out to not really be my thing. Maybe I've been spoiled by the always amazing Texas Roadhouse in Union City, but the ribeye had more of an earthy, peppery taste instead of a beefy taste I prefer. $34.99 a pound was definitely more than I wanted to pay, but I had high hopes.

Otherwise, service was fast and efficient and they seem to have a great selection of other items in store.

I hopped over to the Prather Ranch shop down the way to compare prices and they were about $10 cheaper per pound. Next time!
author: Nicole H.

description: I came to have lunch at the ferry building today and to sit out on the pier to enjoy my food and the scenery. I got the Chili-of-the-Month at GGMC and am sorely disappointed. Being a well-known natural and organic meat company I had high expectations. However, the chili was rather watery and lacked flavor and deliciousness. The meat was in big chunks and didn't taste like it had any seasonings. I regret getting it and am voicing my disappointment.
author: Alice C.

description:
Was not really looking to eat but happened to come across this place near the Ferry Building  and tried their mild sausage on a stick and also some pastrami which I typically don't like too much. The meats were very good and the customer service was also very good.  

I particularly enjoyed the mild Sausage which was around $2 I believe.
author: Rod M.

description:
I don't even know why I haven't updated my review yet, because even after all these years its still just as good as it was the frist time.

Golden Gate Meat Company is my goto spot for a quick breakfast that doesn't break the bank.
It's really my 1st stop when I am back in the city.

This last visit I went with a deluxe breakfast sandwich, it was on a soft butter roll with a perfectly cooked egg, bacon, cheese and hashbrowns, oh my, this was a perfect breakfast sandwich and just what I was craving!

I know the Ferry building has a lot of offer, but Golden Gate Meat Co has been banging out great food for years, just go give them a try!
author: Monica O.

description:
Even before I discovered keto I loved me some meat, and the Golden Gate Meat Company makes every trip to the Ferry Building a more fun excursion.

To start, I always stop off for a sausage-on-a-stick. They offer two varieties, one spicy, one mild with a bit of a fennel touch.

There are both raw meats on sale and prepared foods, like beef or pork slathered in a very tasty barbecue sauce. Often my last purchase at the Ferry Building is a bag of meat, destined for a short stay in the fridge.
author: Michael S.

description:
Golden Gate Meat Company had a concessions stand in the Ferry Building. They had a good variety of premade food such pizza, hot dogs, lasagna, veggies, etc.

[ Pepperoni Pizza ] I got a slice of pizza, which came in the form of a square. It was warm and ready to serve. I thought the cheese to tomato sauce ratio was really off. There was so much cheese that I could barely taste the tomato sauce. It felt like I was eating melted cheese on doughy bread. To give them the benefit of the doubt, I might have just got unlucky and came upon a bad plate of pizza. 

Although I didn't have the best experience this time around, I would be down to try their other foods as they looked quite appetizing.
author: Annie Z.

description:
I come here almost every morning to grab my Salmon Bagel and Lox. 
Service.. 100 thumbs up, people are friendly, fast and attentive. 

Bagel with Salmon is the only thing i have gotten here and haven't tried anything else. But i do love my bagels! A lot of times I feel heavy after a bagel, I can honestly feel it inside my stomach and my stomach literally pops out and I can be easily confused for a woman who has yet to announce she is pregnant, but you can tell she gained some baby weight. 

This morning I came to Golden Gate Meat Company and they already knew what I wanted and it just made my day! It seems they remember their customers and remember what they eat, which makes the process super fast so you can grab, eat and go to work!
author: Galya T.

description: Tasty bbq ribs, but nothing hot about their hot food. Roasted veggies are a nice change from typical hot deli fare, with solid green beans, mushrooms, squash and peppers, in addition to the broccoli, cauliflower and carrots. Beef pot pie and its crust is worth it all, soft yet flaky crust so amazing!
author: Julia N.

description:
Walking around the ferry building we couldn't help but notice that everyone was eating breakfast sandwiches. Then we saw the sandwich board and the long line, we found them. 

Service was friendly and efficient and within a few minutes we had a sausage sandwich and a bacon sandwich. 

These things are hearty and piled high with meat, cheese and eggs. While completely huge and dense, these things didn't have much taste. A little bit of salt and pepper would have done these sandwiches justice. Fortunately there were condiments available but having to pull this thing apart to season it was a messy affair. 

Aside from the lack of salt and pepper, the bagel itself was fresh, dense and chewy. Everything how a bagel should be, so good. 

Advice when ordering, be sure to ask them to season the eggs with plenty of s&p, you won't be disappointed.
author: Alexander C.

description: The chicken is so fresh!!!! Great prices and local, easy location to access in sf would highly highly recommend!!!!
author: Zoe M.

description:
The pulled pork plate was a solid deal for $8. It came with half a box of pulled pork and half a plate of veggies. My friend got the steak and he didn't get as much meat and had to pay more. 

The pulled pork had a light salty taste, but was a bit dry in my opinion. I like really vinegary and soft pulled pork. Besides that, the veggies were solid and I liked the meal.
author: Nathan C.

description: I was there  on Saturday morning to buy bacon.They were not busy at all.The woman helping me  was not helpful and was impatient with my questions.I will not make the trip down to their company again.
author: Victoria S.

description:
Stop in to get a breakfast sandwich / Stop in to grab a fresh salad / Stop in to get a hot lunch / Stop in to buy a seriously rustic supper

The prices are probably better than most of the other places here. The salads are packed to take-away.

My favorite option is to stop in to grab a meal to go.
author: The Adv G.

description: Decided to just try this place because i was super hungry. I didn't know what kind of made-to-order foods they offered or if they only cut you slices of meat. I blindly asked the worker at the register if they sold any hot foods. I don't know if it's because we came later in the day (around 3pm) but the only foods they said they had were meatloaf or pastrami sandwich. I chose the meatloaf sandwich and after about 5 minutes my order was ready. The sandwich was okay. It could have been better. The meatloaf was kind of dry. Overall, I don't think the place is bad; I think I just ordered the wrong thing. The service was good though. The workers were really nice and friendly. Total was just $8 for a pretty filling sandwich.
author: Gina B.

description: This is my favorite to-go lunch place. Shredded beef and bbq pork are my favorite. Veggies are not so great, so I usually just get some meat in a plastic container here. Everything is pretty cheap and tasty. Definitely recommend!
author: Lana B.

description:
This review is for the butcher shop; I've never actually eaten the food here.

As a San Francisco native, you'd think I'd be over the grand tourist attraction that is the Ferry Building. Well, I'm not. It's my one stop shop for all kinds of specialty groceries from mushrooms to charcuterie to cheeses to olive oils to just about everything. I am very frequently at the Ferry Building when I have a Ratatouille-like imagination for what to cook for dinner.

I don't do my daily meat shopping at the Golden Gate Meat Company (you can go poor doing that), but it is reliable for great quality meats, GAME, offal, etc. that you just can't find at a regular old butcher shop (at least without calling ahead). I feel like I'm cheating on my butcher by coming here! Duck breast--they've got it. Wild boar-- they've got it. Cornish game hens, quail, and squab-- they've got it. Foie gras, veal galore, beef galore, all the makings of your culinary dreams-- hell yeah they've got it.

I especially prefer the osso buco here. At many other butcher shops, the veal shanks are small and sometimes even prepackaged. GGMC has the largest veal shanks I could find! This one time I was cooking a big dinner and they even sawed more pieces for me from a whole shank. It was so hardcore butcher, I was impressed.

That just about completes my shopping list, but they have an intense game selection including venison, buffalo, elk, & pheasant. My one complaint is that they don't have bear. Just kidding (but can you though?).
author: Stephanie Joyce D.

description: We were looking for a mid-morning snack or, more precisely, start grazing the San Francisco waterfront. The menu showed a sausage bagel that sounded good. I ordered the spicy sausage and my wife ordered mild sausage. I was expecting it to be a sausage-bagel sandwich; but, it was served open faced that turned out to be a good way to eat it. The bagels were toasted just right, not too crunchy, with nice layer of regular cream cheese. My first impression of the sausage was that it was not spicy enough; but, after a few bites the spice started to kick in. Not too spicy but definitely a nice warm spice. While we were waiting for the bagels to be prepared, I noticed a number of other menu items that I would like to try. This maybe a regular stop when I get off the ferry.
author: Gregory S.

description:
Golden Gate Meat Company is the best butcher in San Francisco without question. Excellent sausages (too many to list), a wide variety of pork, lamb, chicken, game and cold cuts as well as a wide array of beef, including "butcher cuts" and wagyu. What I really love about Golden Gate is that they are a real butcher. They will cut it the way you want. You want a bone-in 1-1/2" thick New York? No problem. Short rib braise and you want the pieces a certain length? Easy. Making meatballs? They have excellent ground chuck, ground pork (not lean) and ground veal. If its not in the case, they will go into the dry aging room and bring out a whole primal to show you. You want 4 ounces of San Danielle prosciutto di parma to go with that nice melon you just got at the farmer's market, sliced paper thin? They have you covered.

They also have excellent chicken and veal stock. And everyone; Chris, Margo, Dean, Romero, James, Carmen... is super friendly and helpful.
author: John C.

description: I had ribs and vegetables.the ribs tasted sweet  which is pretty good at a relatively reasonable price.should try some more meat next time.
author: Clare G.

description:
If you're looking to wow yourself with a hearty home-cooked meal - take a beautiful walk on over to the Ferry Building to Golden Gate Meat Company.

Their meat is locally sourced and you can pick up any accompanying ingredients at the darling grocery store - right next store.

I've always found their staff to be informative and friendly - when I have had any questions about their vast variety of meat offerings. 

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
Meattttt. All kinds of stuff here and a hot deli with fair prices.

Here's some more words to fill the minimum character limit.
author: Chris T.

description:
For once, I don't have too much to say about a place. I tend to write long-winded essays about the food and the location, but this time, I just came to grab a quick bite before heading back to a convention. That quick bite? A hot dog.

Sometimes, I just crave a good, meaty hot dog. Golden Gate Meat Company's was a snappy, juicy frank with loads of options for individually-packaged condiments like ketchup, mustard, and relish. It's a reminder that as much as foodies like us love overloading toppings onto classics, simple is good too. 

Wish I'd gotten here in time to get a bagel, but they were all sold out by lunch. :( If I ever return, I'm eyeing those pot pies!
author: Gwen W.

description:
There were two girls working behind the counter, the first girl's attitude was okay and the second girl was straight forward. The first girl wore makeup and was who served us had a serious face the time we ordered, and had patience for the guy behind us who changed his order three times. The second girl was the cashier and she smiled sincerely one time when my friend almost dropped his wallet and she had a neutral attitude, nothing bright not boring looking. Just attentive. 

The utensils & napkins were placed right next to the cash register so you won't miss it. They are free to customers but if you weren't then they were $.50 or $1.00 per thing (the price might be price since I'm trying to remember how much it costs but they definitely charge you if you aren't a customer). 

The food...was sad. We chose the combo/3 food item in a take out tray option (my friend ordered it so idk what it's called exactly). We got Pulled Pork, Mac & Cheese, and Vegetables. I'll go back someday and try a sandwich because everyone is raving about those godly sandwiches. I wished the girl wouldn't be lazy with servings because HONESTLY?! One freaking cauliflower?! I bet there were more veggies we didn't get because one halfass scoop isn't enough. The pulled pork was bomb though. The Mac & Cheese tasted mostly milky cheese & black pepper, bleh. 

I could have taken a better picture but since my friend was in a hurry to leave, we both had to gobble this up so I took one pic. I just found out the pic was out of focus  ugh, I'll put it out there anyways so that you guys can at least see it in some way. Btw, the veggies in that pic looks like it filled up the space but the broccoli was just holding up the zucchinis as if it was cheerleading practice so that it looks fuller than it is. 

Don't try what I tried & maybe go for something else, but if that's not good, I wouldn't go back to this place AT ALL.
author: Emi G.

description: Simply the best breakfast sandwich you can find! We love this place! The bacon has such a flavorful taste and the egg and cheese on a soft croissant- mouth watering. Run - do not walk and have breakfast with these guys.
author: Tracy C.

description:
Let me just say one thing: breakfast sandwich. Not much to say except I definitely am a fan. Then again, this really is the only thing I've tried from here.

I'll be brief- the bread is nice and soft, spongy, and perfect. Buttery, too, I should add. The egg is cooked perfectly each time. Not too wet of a yolk to the point where it's running down your hands, but not too dry, either. Not so much ham to the point the sandwich is too salty to enjoy. Not sure how the bacon breakfast sandwich tastes, since I always get the ham. But I assume the bacon must be exceptional, considering this is a meat company.

The only thing I will say, though, is that for the price, you wish you could be getting a little more than just a breakfast sandwich. Adding in a hash brown and a coffee or something would be nice. $6.50 is a bit much if you ask me. Though, I will give them a bit of a break- Ferry builiding prices, SF in general, plus the sandwich is bigger than your average breakfast sammie--understandable.

GREAT breakfast sandwich. I'll be back next time I'm not ballin' on a budget
author: Meghan J.

description:
A cute butcher located inside the ferry building.

I haven't been here in some time but wandered in since I was looking for some beef bones in the city - and I've been weary of buying them from asian meat marts (even though they're SO much cheaper there ugh). These fine gentlemen had a bucket of veal bones at $4.99 a pound. A little expensive for bones, but it is veal AND in the ferry building. What can you expect? I was happy to see that they were of high quality, and seemed fresh. 

Also, both the butcher and girl at the cash wrap were very sweet, with fantastic customer service.

4 stars because I do think Prather's steaks are better, but this place has a much larger selection (quail, duck, etc) so I think they're both good for different things and would definitely come back!
author: Jackie C.

description: It's strange that I haven't eaten or explored the ferry building that much and it's right down by my work. Came to this deli with two of my co workers today and I was very pleased with what I got! The lady behind the counter was nice and she hooked it up with the meat! I ordered a chicken sandwich with blue cheese sauce and onions and peppers on a sour dough bread. It came with a lot of chicken! We decided to eat out back and watch the ferries coming in. The bread and chicken along with the sauce were fantastic. Topped it off with a nice cold coke and I couldn't ask for a better lunch. All for about $9 bucks! A steal in this area! I definitely will come back and try the bbq chicken they have as well it looks great!
author: James R.

description: This restaurant inside the ferry building when you walk in is to your left. They sell meat and meat products and an array of food. I wanted the bagel but they were out by 10am. So I went to for the bacon and egg sandwich that was good and toasted with cheese. They also had some skillet potatoes that looked good so I couldnt resist. $11 dollars for thebaandwich and potatoes. I had my coffee already. Take to go or eat there.
author: Theresa G.

description:
I remember dropping by here a few years ago, liked their chili, so I'd try the meatloaf sandwich.  It's just meatloaf, a sourdough bun and some sauce.  That's it.  No veggies, no lettuce, nothing. 

I tried it but the meat was crumbly and falling apart. 

I still may try their breakfast menu but this was not going anywhere.  Create more attractive sandwiches please!  Good price though.
author: James M.

description: They variety of beef selections are unbelievable. You can find very high quality of beef at this store . Always fresh products and helpful and knowladgable staff. A little pricey but lets accept the fact that everything comes with a price.
author: Fikret D.

description:
Golden Gate sells fresh meats and prepped foods. was deciding between hot dog (3.5), sausage on a stick(2.5) or beef pie (8), gentleman eating beef pie nearby said it was very good. noticed chicken pot pie at "out the door" was $15.

eats: beef meat pie(8)
-crust had nice texture, definitely housemade, not commercially sourced
-savory chucks of beef, not much aftertasteft
-fulfilling

crumbs:
-hot dog a good value, next time for sure.
-2 table seating area.
author: Victor G.

description:
It was just bad. I wanted to get the beef plate but upon seeing it (very dry looking, shredded BBQ, that didn't look appealing), I decided on the pastrami. A mistake. I tasted it at the counter while the woman was running my credit card and it was horrible. It was dry, it was flavorless and the consistency was wrong for pastrami. The cooks didn't know what they were doing.

I told the woman immediately, 'This is not good' and she mumbled something and gave me a cup of BBQ because I could tell she knew it was bad. (The BBQ sauce was also bad.)

I would not recommend this place. I can't believe anyone that has had meat would like what I tasted. I know GGMC is supposed to be known for fresh meats or something, but the meat didn't even taste fresh, and I could definitely taste it because it was so poorly flavored. Sigh. Upside is I only wasted 12.00 dollars.
author: Lem B.

description:
PSA: Without question, THE WORST pastrami sandwich I've ever eaten, by a very long margin. 

Was excited by all the best pastrami sandwich reviews. Not sure what has happened since those.
author: Sai M.

description:
Total disaster--I ordered a deboned chicken for stuffed chicken galantine. The butchers claimed they knew how to debone but what I ended up getting was a chopped up chicken! They charged me $10 extra!!! Never again...what a bunch of amateurs!!!

Whole Foods staff knew what to do and doesn't charge add'l for deboning.
author: Fermin N.

description:
I've eaten here twice now, several years apart. Previously I had the BBQ sandwich, which was juicy and yummy - and messy. I remember wrestling with it for awhile, trying not to get my clothes dirty. (If I recall correctly,  the sandwich won. Which is why I always carry stain remover with me.)

Despite the siren song of BBQ beef calling me closer, this time I opted for the hot pastrami. The kaiser roll was fresh and delicious  - a little crusty outside, soft inside. But the meat was not very juicy and lacked flavor, despite the house-made dijon.
 
There were some good-looking veggies but I was headed for the ferry to Sausalito and couldn't juggle them.

Cost was good. Only  $10 for a 6" sandwich and a bottle of water. Not bad, considering the location. One of the nice things about the Ferry Building is there are plenty of places inside and outside to sit down and eat. 

It's a good place. I will come back next time I visit the Ferry Building. I plan to branch out and try one of the daily specials.
author: Violet H.

description:
This is a butcher counter inside/adjacent/part of  a grocery (farm fresh to you) inside the ferry building along with a grab and go counter. So it's kind of like a matryoshka doll, if a matryoshka was a food business.

Parking here is typical for San Francisco street parking which is to say they really isn't any parking close by. Not to worry the ferry building is something  of a transit hub and there are perhaps a dozen ways to get here that don't involve driving. 

The golden gate company has two counters-a very professional butchers counter inside of farm fresh to you grocery which specializes in meat items for home use and a take away food counter for ready to eat items such as pot pies and sandwiches. The outside facing counter also has cokes and what not in a cooler.

The inside meat counter offers custom cuts of meat upon demand, and is a full service meat counter. All types of meat products are offered including specialist sausages such as bratwurst and spicy/mild Italian and veal. Also deli meats such as ham and pastrami. And bacon. Oh my god the bacon is awesome. 

A skilled butcher is always  aplus, but I'd be remiss if I didn't add a note about the sausage. This is not your working mans bratwurst that'd you'd find for sale from a cart in a train station. This is a elite dining experience made with boar and organ meat. The Italian sausage with sage and rabbit isn't the kind of thing you want to mix into jambalaya. It's too rich a food for that.  It would be good with a plate of cheese and fruit along with wine. Consider yourself warned.

The outside counter focuses on hot and ready items to go.The are a limited amount of options and they are usually pre made (unless your timing is really lucky) but still awesome. The breakfast sandwiches are sheer perfection and the pot pies are a true delight. And hash browns. Oh. My. God. Get the picante sauce when you order them, it changes the whole hash brown experience in the best possible way. 

 No place to sit and eat, but there's a few stand up counters close by inside the ferry building and of course plenty of benches outside facing the ocean. The outside food counter is perfect for an a la carte lunch or breakfast nosh.
author: Steven W.

description: Best breakfast sandwich ever ! My co worker comes here in the morning so I decided to stop by and I'm in love!!!
author: Miranda C.

description:
This place is legit!!! 
After walking miles to Ferry 1 building, we were starving...scouted the place and ended up here - happy we did!!
Had a whole wheat bagel with sun dried tomato cream cheese topped with spicy sausage!!! 
Shared this with my friend and afterwards my internal fat girl wish I got my own...it was soooo yummy!!! So I got the mild sausage and had with mustard....ahahah!! :) 
Will go back when in town!
And a plus - the young dude behind counter was delightful :)
author: Beanie B.

description: Took my cousin to her first San Francisco trip and we rode the bart to embarcadero. There are so many food places to choose from. We decided on Golden Gate Meat Company when we saw the chicken pot pie. Neither of us are big meat eaters. In fact, I don't think we would have ordered anything else on the menu. This place is inside the Ferry building and not a proper sit-down restaurant, so we weren't expecting it to be that great. OH MY GOSH!!!!!! The chicken was so soft and delicious. All the contents just melted in your mouth. Even the crust was so soft and not hard or crumbly. It was so great to get a home cooked meal in the middle of all the bustle. We were already really hungry, but the pot pie hit the spot. I think this is probably the best pot pie I have ever had. It's a little shop where you can get restaurant quality food. I may be taking more trips out to the Ferry Building just to eat here. The only thing that was kind of annoying was that there was no place to sit. It was close to Christmas, so the place was packed with tourists, we had to stand. The cashier was kind of moody. That being said, we only paid $9 each, and I think most of the menu items are reasonably priced compared to what you would see in some of the other shops. It was also very filling and didn't leave me feeling heavy or sick to my stomach. Pot Pie FTW!
author: D. K.

description:
Great place to stop by for a quick lunch. Looked at some reviews and went with the beef pot pie! 

Seriously one of the best pot pies I have eaten in my life for only $8!  Crust is super flaky and soft while the inside is warm and creamy with a good portion of meat and filling. Felt full afterwards.

Also some tables to stand and eat outside of the shop.

Would recommend and I will definitely be back to try other things out :).
author: Steven C.

description:
Breakfast sandwiches are like pizza. Even the mediocre ones are dam satisfying. So what elevates this breakfast sandwich to a five star rating? The same reasons that separate great food from the chaff, perfect execution paired with quality ingredients at a reasonable price.

Egg in this breakfast sandwich was perfectly cooked. It was skirting raw, but clearly firm and cooked. Any longer and the egg would've been the standard hard-ish, boarderline powdery, egg you can find in a mcmuffin. Stopping before the mcprocess made the egg white silky and flavorful. The melted cheddar atop the silky egg created a creamy sharp contrast for the sandwich. 

Bacon was crispy, smokey, and a thick generous cut. They use bacon that's sold at the meat counter. You can taste the difference in quality compared to that of generic diner bacon.  

Bread was soft and buttery. After eating artisan sourdough all weekend I was delighted by how soft and "biteable" the bread was. No chewy crusts here!

For $6.50, this sandwich was the perfect way to start my day as a faux SF tourist.
author: Catherine S.

description:
So this place closes at 5:30 and I made the cardinal sin of showing up at 5:20 looking over an empty counter. I had to ask a guy cleaning the tables out front for help. He rudely responds to me, "what do you want?"

I'm looking for lamb neck. Now I'm no expert at meat, but the recipe I wanted to try out called for lamb neck so I just asked for that. The guy shouts to the back, everybody is basically packing up to leave and one unlucky guy looks my way and says, "yeah I can do that for you, give me a minute." I felt like I was seriously inconveniencing these guys.

So eventually, the lamb comes up. And it's literally just a skinned (I think?) lamb's neck. Not cut up or anything, and he's just looking at me like I just ran over his dog. 

Like I said, I don't really know what I'm doing, I'm going to a butcher because they have the meat, and prepare the meat, and here I am, at 5:25, feeling like I'm keeping everybody in the entire shop from going home, so of course I take it, hoping I can saw through the neck bone and chop it up for my thoroughly planned dinner (that didn't go over well at all, so I just trashed the neck, I'm sorry, lamb, for wasting you). 

I was out of their hair by 5:28. 

I'm kind of glad about that, because I think if they took any longer, 5:30 would hit and they would have trashed my meat and just flipped me the bird while dropping their aprons like a mic while the whole store sealed up like a bank under robbery. But then again, I wouldn't have wasted $12.

I won't go back.
author: Gravity S.

description: bad food a lot of salt, filipino woman behaved rude, The food very dry. The vejetables are very spicy, The chicken very Small y expensive and the cold food of the normal, no return!
author: Grace T.

description:
First off, I didn't realize how HUGE these sandwiches were! One sandwich can easily feed 2 people.

My hot pastrami sandwich was so good. The bread had a crunch to it and the pepper from the pastrami and the Dijon mustard was a great combo. My son enjoyed the Italian sausage sandwich, but did say there was a bit too much sauce. The lamb slider was also good but we just had so much food that I only took one bite of it. We each only finished half of our sandwiches, but were both satisfied.

Overall, great sandwiches to take outside and enjoy the view of the bay.
author: Marissa P.

description:
Greatest customer service of all time!!! 

I've drooled over this meat case in the past but being that I'm out of town made me hesitate actually buying anything, never again!! We explained to the guy that helped us (I will forever regret not getting his name) that we wanted to buy some sausages but that we needed them to withstand the 8 hr road trip back home. Without out any hesitation he leaped to our rescue and offered to vacuum seal and freeze our order for us. We were so ecstatic that we went  a little nuts and ordered one of everything!! We then came back the next day to pick up our package and ordered some of their amazing cold cuts for the rode. We're now back home, and our meat made it here without a glitch. This dude was so helpful and went well above and beyond his duties as a meat god that I need you all to visit this beautiful man and buy all this butcher shop has to offer.
author: Sabrina D.

description:
Came by here last Thursday after 2:30 pm with my husband while walking around the Ferry Building. We were hungry and decided to get one beef pot pie and one turkey pot pie. Total came out to $14.01. 

My husband really liked his beef pot pie. He liked that the flaky crust was not soggy even with the last bite. The beef pot pie was rather filling and a good size for one person.

I have never been a fan of pot pies in general. But I thought the turkey pot pie was good (I am still on a quest to find the best pot pie I suppose). Just the beef pot pie, the crust did not go soggy and held up to the pie. I also liked that I could actually see and taste the chunks of turkey in this. I think the flavors were okay but would have preferred something a bit bolder. 

Overall, I think it was a fair price to pay for a late lunch, especially being in a tourist area. I would come back here again and would like to try one of their sandwiches next time.

One thing I want to mention though is that we ended up eating at the one and only high top table right in front of the area to order cooked food (there is an area to purchase raw meat in their market area). People passing by were gawking at us and our food... I get that they are just browsing but it annoyed me that we were kind of on display (it's kind of like hungry restaurant goers looking through the window at the poor person eating right in front). So if you end up buying any food here, wouldn't recommend eating at that table too.
author: Vic C.

description:
Hot pastrami peppered sandwich with Dijon mustard spread that is smacked in between a crunchy bread for 9 bucks, hits the spot for lunch!

They specialize on their fresh meat produce, so get anything meaty here!

They have good-looking chicken pot pies on clear window display.  Opt for that, if you don't feel like pork or beef.  They have beef pot pies, but chicken is more homely.

It's a mighty and meaty meal at this shop!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Came here right as everything seemed to be closing down, but there wasn't much of a wait here. 

Seems a little pricey, but considering the location it wasn't too bad. We got some cured meat slices and a tub of duck fat for fries. Everything was pretty good. Guy seemed nice while helping us. I think we may not frequent this place because of where it's at, but I'd stop by for a snack next time I'm on the pier!
author: Carol M.

description:
They have the freshest Meat and the best selction I have seen so far in San Francisco. And their produce is always fresh and superb.
The service is very frendly.
I highly recommend the Veal!
author: Stacee P.

description: Been buying meat here for years upon years and never had a bad cut or a bad experience! The guys & gals are always ready with a smile, and they know their stuff. I won't buy pork anywhere else, period, and their ready-made burger patties are deeeelicious. But everything is top-notch. Whatchu waitin' fo? Get yo self to Golden Gate!
author: LaShonda F.

description:
One of my favorite butcher shops in the city, Golden Gate Meat Company has a huge variety of both common and exotic cuts of meat ranging from quail to wild boar sausage to bison shoulder. I think they might even sell rabbit as well. You know they have a lot of options when they even have a gourmet butcher prepared dog food available.

Also fantastic at this shop is their deli, which serves meats, sandwiches and pot pies, all of which are delicious. I had the beef pot pie yesterday and it was very flaky and had a tasty filling with big chunks of beef inside.

They are located in the ferry building and share a hallway with hog island oyster company.
author: Mark O.

description: Excellent breakfast sandwiches. When friends visit me in SF, I like to take them to Blue Bottle for coffee and grab breakfast here. Then, take your food behind the Ferry Building for a fantastic view of the bridge!
author: Lindsay B.

description:
Probably my favorite food place within the Ferry Building. 

It's essentially meat haven. Buy your own meats to cook at home. Or... buy some lunch/dinner. The pot pies, spare ribs, sausages, and pulled pork are all viable options.
author: Tunaidi A.

description:
One bite into their piping hot beef pot pie, I spurted out "this is 5 stars!"  BF looked at me with surprise since I never say that while eating LOL.  For $7, I was hoping this is some darn good pot pie and I was wrong.  This is the BEST MOST FREAKING AWESOME potpie I've ever devoured. 

The beef filling was perfectly seasoned, not too salty (hate that), thick creamy broth, delicious bites of veggies mixed in.  The crust was flaky, hot, and stayed nonsoggy through out.  

I shared this with my BF and sis because I'm a good person even though the pot pie was a one person portion.  We were going to eat lunch afterwards so I didn't buy another one.  I think I could easily eat two of these myself.  The chicken pot pie is next on my list.

I kind of want to drive to the Embarcadero right now and eat a pot pie.  Damn you, work!
author: Yue L.

description:
I love chicken pot pie and was excited to see a bunch of turkey pot pies whispering eat me.  So I did.  The crust was flaky and the gravy kept it from being dry.  I didn't care for the overall flavor which my tastebuds keep screaming too salty.  I was able to finish it by drinking lots of water but I wouldn't order turkey pie again.

Marie Calendar's remains as my fav pot pie.
author: Soo H.

description: Fantastic discovery! Loads of unusual and hard to find cuts of meat and the retail isles are superb. The sandwiches are a must ; )
author: Stefan S.

description:
I decided that I wanted to grill some meat with my day and our neighbour tonight, and there were limited options as to where to find a proper meat market. The ones bear my house were closed, I decided to make a trip here. When I got to the counter, Tim greeted me and was very polite and awesome. 

I asked him to make me some recommendations. He asked me how many I was entertaining. I told him three adults and one pitbull.  He suggested the hanger steak and asked if I wanted him to season it for me. I told him that would be great. I also purchased two pounds of baby back ribs that he also seasoned. Tim was very down to earth and helpful, and I will definitely be coming back. I'm going to have to go back and try their fresh made sausages for my next grilling function.
author: Tiffany M.

description: Stopped here for a snack before catching the ferry back to Tiburon. The turkey pot pie was excellent and just the right size for a mid afternoon snack!
author: Angela D.

description: The prices may have been reasonable, but the food is just alright. But what stands out to me the most is how rude and unpleasant these people are. They had no sense of good customer service and seemed irritated to be there... and we weren't even difficult customers at all-we ordered straightforwardly and didn't ask a bunch of questions. Because of how rude they were, I'd never, ever come back.
author: ina m.

description: BBQ Pork sandwich was filled with meat and delicious.  The pork on a stick was a nice snack as we walked around the ferry building.
author: Lisa T.

description:
I had a terrific experience at the butcher counter here! 

During a lunch break I ventured over to the Ferry Building to purchase finer grocery goods for a special dinner I'm preparing. I viewed the options in the meat case and decided that the best option for my cooking skill level was the chicken breast stuffed with sausage and brie. 

Now, $9.99/lb is a bit pricey for chicken breast, but as I quantified my personal expenses by preparing a fancy stuffed chicken breast with the contents provided I realized that I would be spending about the same as well as taking the time to stuff it correctly. Therefore, I believe the price is fair. 

The best part about my experience was chatting with the friendly butchers. They were quick to give cooking technique recommendations as well as side dish suggestions. 

I will be back when I need to procure higher-end meats for special occasions! I'd go every day if it weren't so expensive.
author: Andrea H.

description:
I've been hesitant to write a review for Golden Gate Meat Company because it's difficult not to start the review off with out it sounding suspiciously inappropriate. 

Alas, it's been too good to me over the years not to. So here goes. 
This is my favorite place to get my meat in the Bay Area (slight pause for comedic value) In all do respect to Lunardi's in Pleasant Hill the meat selection is slightly better  in my experience.  The people who work the shop aren't as aggressive in trying to help you which I like but when you do need it they are more than informative. Something that your run of the mill grocery store butcher isn't. They're passionate about their meats and it shows in the quality.  

Prices are pretty steep comparatively but you get what you pay for assuming you don't screw it up in the cooking process. I think after writing this I'll head in there today to pick up something for dinner. I suggest you do too.
author: Joco F.

description:
They are not lying when they call themselves a meat company. All their hot items is primarily meat.  Although the items are on hot trays waiting to be served you can tell the products are freshly made and quality.  The meatloaf comes in a generous portion and has a nice solid meat taste. You can tell the filler is limited here. Their pot pies are quite the delicious mix of puff pastry, gravy and you choice of beef or chicken. There are two things that I normally come here for, the first being their chili. It is a nice hearty beef and bean chili that has a bold flavor and a bit if kick. I add an extra kick with jalapeños they have as condiments.  The other time is there sausage on a stick. I get it spicy. Have one for a snack or two for a meal! 

As with all places in the ferry building, it can be pricey.  However, with the different options they have, it doesn't have to be. two sausage on a stock will run you a bit over $5.
author: Veasna H.

description: Bacon is good and worth the money.  Can't wait to try other things here.  Service is friendly and fast.
author: Chris L.

description: We love this butcher - a former chef. He really knows his stuff. He's a great resource for preparing any meat dish. We like to buy a flank steak here and have the butcher slice a pocket in it crosswise. Then we stuff it with herbed dressing. Yum! The quality of the meats here is excellent as well.
author: Paula H.

description: I tried the Chicken Pot Pie ($8). I loved the crust but the insides were not flavorful enough. I did love the use of chicken thigh and not chicken breast. The chicken was juicy and tender. Some of my coworkers got the bbq sandiwch and they weren't super satisfied with it. It was just meat in a sandwich, personally I would add onions to it, to give it a little crunch. The meat looked a little dry as well. The service was quite fast though, which is great for lunch in fidi.
author: Polly L.

description: Their pot pie flakiness game is very strong. Turkey pot pie was bomb.
author: Thielson D.

description: The egg, bacon, and cheese breakfast sandwich was amazing. The price was also great. The service was outstanding.
author: Kelli Y.

description:
I like coming to the Ferry Building for lunch because people can go buy whatever they like and then go grab a bench outside to eat together. This latest trip to the Ferry building I found myself here because the lines at some other places were just too crazy.   

I've been to Golden Gate Meat Co twice for lunch and I've enjoyed my meal both times.  This time I went with the barbecue sandwich. It's a rather simple sandwich. Barbecue pork on a loaf of bread. It was tasty meat but I think something else in the sandwich would be nice,  maybe some coleslaw to give it a bit of freshness and acid. The other time I went here I got a lunch combo plate of meatloaf and mac n cheese. This was also simple but satisfying.  Its not cheap but compared to other options in the area it's reasonable.  

They are popular for their potpies and pastrami sandos so I'll have to try them next time!
author: Huy V.

description: Worse service ever. After noticing meat being slammed onto my Pastrami Sandwich, I politely asked if it comes with cheese. Her response,  "I already wrapped it." My response, "Anything that is wrapped can be unwrapped." It became worse. When the cashier rung up my order, it became $1.50 more. I then asked why $1.50 more. I was told for the cheese. I've never in my life been any place that first doesn't ask what you want on your sandwich, and two, charge for cheese. Stupid me took the sandwich. I will never go back. They will be sorry if they have a social media page once I'm done.
author: Terrence P.

description:
Just like a kid, I look forward to my lunch break almost every day. Where to go is sometimes the hardest choice to make.  The Ferry Building is always a fun place to go on a sunny day, although can be crowded with several lines which bites into my lunching hour. 

Craving some kind of meat sandwich, I popped through each place finding the Golden Gate Meat Company to be very tempting. No lines. Perfect. I ordered a Beef Brisket Wrap which is their October sandwich of the month. It was the size of a burrito with sauteed peppers and onions and a sweet yet tangy barbecue sauce that was so good for about $7.00 or $8.00. My friend ordered the Chicken Cordon Blue Sandwich, which was really great too. 

They have some tables set up in their marketplace, so we sat and enjoyed our sandwiches instead of waiting in lines and laughed about how easy it was to get fast good service and still have time for dessert.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Best BBQ pulled pork sandwich EVER. You will not be disappointed! The pulled pork is tender, savory and flavorful and the juices soak into the soft, fresh bread bun. Knocked one star off for the service. Not the friendliest people but the food is delish! 

Grab a pulled pork sandwich and enjoy it outside on one of the benches that looks out on the bay.
author: Robin N.

description:
The meat case looked wonderful; it was filled with things, like veal chops, that my local supermarket does not carry. S does most of the cooking so I just bought a couple of lamb sausages for him. I was concerned that if I brought home some pricey cuts of meat I might have to be the one to cook them. 

Back to the sausages, I liked the garlic mango one more than the hot one; Lucy said hers were just okay. 

I suspect if I go back and purchased other cuts of meat the rating would go up.  I do like the idea of shopping at a butcher store where I can see the meat in the case, have them wrap my purchase and hand it to me.
author: Terry T.

description: I had the chicken gumbo for lunch today.   Loved it.  I picked up an olive roll from Acme bakery as a side treat!   Delicious!!!!!
author: Reyna M.

description: Prior to boarding Yelp 's birthday bash, we definitely wanted to eat a meal beforehand. Located inside of the Ferry Building on Pier 1 this butcher shop also has a deli part to it. I went for their BBQ pork sandwich. This sandwich is so epically good that I was salivating before even taking a bite out of it. The sandwich had a deliciously soft bread roll and it was packed with meaty goodness. The sandwich was so big that I had troubles finishing it. Overall, if you are looking for a quick bite to eat in the chaos that is the Ferry Building then definitely go to this spot.
author: Cristal C.

description:
We liked it so much that we came here TWICE yesterday.

The visit to The Ferry Building was unintentional because we were supposed to go to Ike's Place and Dynamo Donuts but because I am such a Barbie girl sometimes, or almost all the time, I kind of forgot about it and just parked near AT&T Park because he was bitching about it but even though things went awry at first, I'm sure he will agree that it was a great day.

It was all about their spicy sausage w/ mustard on a stick.  For $2 you can devour a fulfilling spicy protein that will keep you wanting more.  Their glass case showcasing their hot foods look enticing but we were set on the sausage on a stick.  If you get 1, it is good for a snack but if you get 2, you might as well get 3 because there is no other way.  I simply don't see any other way.  

Service was quite awesome.  On our first visit, the lady commented on us because I was in Giants gear and the fiance was in Dodgers gear... she thought it was funny because a couple came earlier that was the exact opposite of us (girl in Dodgers and the guy in Giants).  

I think this will be THE spot we will hit whenever we go to SF now.
author: Tram N.

description:
Short version: I was on a quest for wild boar meat, either shoulder or loin, for a very special pasta dish, and they have it!!! Excellent service and they're the only folks I know who would have it at almost any given time. (Call ahead, though.)

I called ahead, got a confirmation, had the option to buy over the phone but didn't do that, walked in, they asked me what I wanted to do with it so they can help me cut or grind it. Told them I don't exactly know which cut or grind as I was making ragu for the first time and had 3 conflicting recipes. After a bit of discussion we ended up cubing it up (better for marinading, instead of grinding it up coarsely then not marinading).

Long version: I wanted to surprise my boyfriend with a pasta machine, and ingredients for his favorite, the Wild Boar Ragu. Got the pasta machine ordered from Sur La Table and it was set to be delivered on time. Then on to more difficult part, the meat. Difficult, or so I thought. I first called Fatted Calf in Hayes Valley. They're great but not allowed to carry this meat due to regulations, but they gladly referred Golden Gate Meat Company. Ah, thank God. So I called my new best friends and they did confirm they have some on stock.

The next day I hopped on a train, got off Embarcadero, bought my wild boar and other ingredients at the Ferry Building, and met up with my birthday boy in the area. He didn't suspect anything, although at that point the only person in his mind was Paul McCartney (we went to the Candlestick show!). Sneaked the meat into the fridge, freshened up for Sir Paul, then partied we went. Got home, lit up a candle on a Miette panna cotta (also from the Ferry Building), and unveiled the surprise. :)
author: Paulyne R.

description: Legit chicken pot pie.... Just what I was craving. Really good bang for the buck. I just wish they had a larger size option as well.
author: John S.

description:
Stopped in here to browse when we were walking around the Ferry Building this week.

My husband ended up buying a wonderful steak, that was really reasonably priced. I'm not even a big steak fan, and i thought it was amazing.

This market has all the staples for a wonderful meal, and lots of interesting unique products as well. 

If you're in the Ferry Building, and in search of meat to cook at home, I'd highly recommend this place.
author: Amanda G.

description: Food is ok. Attitude is terrible. If you don't like talking to people, don't work in service industry.
author: Neema A.

description: Had a delicious breakfast sandwich this weekend...with hashbrowns, egg, bacon on it. YUM! Will be back.
author: K. D.

description: I will give GG Meat Company another try in the future but today's experience was terrible. The beef looked and rated like left overs and the roll was harder than concrete sidewalk in front of the Ferry Building. I hope this was just an isolated incident but my prior sandwich was barely "three stars." More to report later.
author: Michael G.

description:
A couple of weeks ago, I had checked out their counter.  I did not even know of this place was in the Ferry Building.  I went to Farm Fresh For You to pick up some producer and noticed it.  On that day, I was purchasing a flank steak from Prather Ranch but made a mental note to find out more about Golden Gate Meat Company.

A little later on, I did a little research.  I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was considered another great option for purchasing quality meat in San Francisco.

When I decided to make pulled pork, Golden Gate seemed like a nice place to purchase a pork butt.

I made my way to the Ferry Building.  It is a short walk.  One of the first things I spotted behind the counter was a beautiful pork butt.  The attendant quickly asked if I needed assistance.  I asked him how much the pork butt weighed.  It was 5 lbs.  I was mentally trying to calculate if it would fit into my Dutch oven.  I had initially been thinking about 4 lbs.  But, come on, it's pulled pork. Isn't more pulled pork better than less?  I decide it will fit.  Luckily, it did, barely. He wrapped it up and gave it to the cashier.

Pork Butt Before Rub:
http://tinyurl.com/79zgzm8

Pork Butt After Rub:
http://tinyurl.com/7g4tonr

Turned into pulled pork sandwich:
http://tinyurl.com/7wd5a8n

I paid for it and carried on with my shopping.

The staff was friendly and helpful.  The meat behind the glass all looks amazing.  There is quite a selection displayed.  The cut of meat I purchased was very good.  Oh, and I did mention pulled pork didn't I?  Well, I took the pork butt home.  Mixed up a rub.  Rubbed it down.  Cooked it for five hours at 225 in a cast iron Dutch oven.  That pork butt made some very tender juicy pulled pork.  I would certainly return to try other cuts of meat.
author: Mark D.

description: I just left golden gate meat company which I been coming to for years and when I asked for a sample from the deli before I purchased it they said only if you buy a pound of the product.  RUDE! All deli's allow you to sample the product- dean and dulica in Napa even allow it.  How cheap of Golden Gate meat company.
author: Fatsha S.

description: Small little food place but the food is good. Especially , spicy sausage.  We bought one and share , and it s so good that we had to come back and bought two more hahah, recommended.
author: Syrena L.

description:
Dirty tables but the food (for humans) is good.

Organic meat dog food for $4.69/lb? Huh? Sorry I don't have a dog to review the dog food. Sad to think that an average homeless shelter (for humans) would probably not spend that much on meat.
author: Glen L.

description: Best butchers in the Bay area, no question. If you think they seem pricey, try ordering the same thing at a restaurant. If you don't see exactly what you want, just ask. The butchers know their stuff and could not be more helpful. When I injured my hand last year, they even sliced and seasoned my order for me to make things easier. The upgrade in quality from supermarket brands and even Whole Foods or Molly Stone is obvious. From the meats to the house-made seasonings/rubs, to the prepared foods and even the brownies, they do it all and do it the best.
author: Mia C.

description: This place rocks. Golden Gate Meat Company is awesome. I would recommend this place to anyone who just loves meat. I just don't know which animal to eat when I am staring at all the meat.  Beef, chicken, and sausage times 10, I just get so confused; I just want to eat it all. I ordered some spicy sausage with mustard.  Awesome.  It could have been spicier though, but it was quite flavorful nonetheless. I love how quick you can get your meal here. The food is fresh and tasty. The staff is attentive and very helpful when you ask for suggestions. If you haven't checked it out you are missing one of the best shops in San Francisco.
author: Pete M.

description:
I was pretty skeptical at first since every other place in the Ferry Building had a line and patrons except the Golden Gate Meat Company. Completely empty. 

I was glad the meat company proved me wrong! The beef pot pie was very delicious, and I generally don't even like pot pie! The crust, meat, and other fillings went well together. Unfortunately not sure how fresh it was, but it was heated and hot hot hot when I got it! My main issue is honestly that it was $7 for something that constituted half a dinner if you're not too hungry. Portions are pretty small.
author: Kimberly Y.

description:
As a lover of all things food, I always enjoy a trip to the Ferry Building. I will say it is a slightly more challenging trip when you have to do it on a lunch hour on a Friday.   Normally I would start at one end and methodically peruse every menu all along the way then make my choice and go back for retrieval. On a lunch hour you gotta make your decision so quickly.  
 
I almost got the Sidekick grilled cheese of the day - sounded good, but no one was eating one so I couldn't SEE it.  I thought about 4505 meats, but they were too pricy.  I was pretty close to the Acme cheese sandwich of the day, but the line was long...so here I am at the Golden Gate Meat Company.  The pot pie was calling my name (I have been seeing the commercials for KFC's chicken pot pie, and I knew that I would never get one from that gross place, so I figured if I was gonna dive, diving here into a pot pie seemed like a good bet.  They are $7 if paid with a credit card $6 if you pay cash - Now who would pay the extra dollar just to charge it???, unprepared morons I'm guessing 
 
I asked the lady if I should get the meat or the turkey, she said meat (I agreed, since it is GG "Meat" Company after all). The filling was ehh, but the crust was REALLY good, I'm  predicting lard-based here.  I want to get that crust and make a rhubarb pie.
author: Amy W.

description:
This place has the best breakfast sandwiches. The egg and bacon is the best!

Usually not too crowded. The only time that the line is long is on Saturdays but even then they are quick. 

I thoroughly enjoy your breakfast!  Do not change it!
author: Spencer L.

description: Best place to get a sandwich when everything else in the ferry building is packed.  Custom sausages are fantastic and worth the price.
author: Dave S.

description:
ALWAYS come here first when I arrive at the Ferry Building.  There is just so many things to do here no better way to start than with a hot stick of sausage!!!  No really, sausage on a stick and of course I opt for spicy.  

Watchout.  This last one I had... oh boy... I took one small bite from the tip and it squirted all over my chest (luckily I had a jacket on, unluckily it was my new Colombia purchase) and I had to clean myself up in front of several onlookers (wiping my right boob with a napkin) with a big smile on my face because I couldn't wait to take another bite and I almost didn't care that I was wet and messy.

No condiments necessary but I asked for a little mustard this time, not bad but I prefer it au naturel.  Next time, I will have to have two at once!
author: Shiho F.

description:
This is for the pastrami sandwich only. The butcher counter looked great. 

The pastrami had far too much pepper on the crust, obscuring any other tastes.  No smokiness to it whatsoever. The house made Dijon was far too tame.  On the bright side,the bread was good.  Skip it.
author: Bonobo M.

description: Good breakfast sandwich, but not a steal at 6.50. If it came with a second egg I'd call it a full breakfast and then it'd be well worth the price. Egg was cooked over-medium, kaiser roll was soft & fresh, bacon was ok, but I expected better from a meat shop.
author: Chris M.

description: great quality meat and the staff are very friendly. it is a bit pricey but they have everything you need. the grocery part of the store is also nice - you can pick up your meat and everything else you need to prep your meal!
author: Esther C.

description:
***************** REVIEW 389 ******************
           
               Another reason to come here to the Ferry Building is the Golden Gate Meat Company.
            
- A great selection of meats always! I bought some USDA NY steak and short rib to cook for my folks over the weekend, awesome!

- A fresh deli counter offer plenty of meat dishes for you to choose from: BBQ pork sandwich, Prime Rib sandwich, Turkey pot pie, Pastrami Brisket, BBQ Beef and much more!

- Great service here always, especially the Blondie lady with short hair, very courteous & super helpful! 

               P.S. The line can get really long on the weekend!
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
Golden Gate Meat Company is located inside the SF Ferry Building. They have a counter that you order at and then take the food to go.

I had the BBQ Pulled Chicken sandwich. The roll it came on was good, but the meat itself just tasted kind of off. Almost like it was cooked yesterday and reheated. This place might have gotten three stars if it wasn't located inside the Ferry Building, but I have higher expectations for places there.

Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing on the wrong day, but it's enough for me not to want to go back-- especially with far better options around it.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
HOT PASTRAMI SANDWICH

that's all i have to say. the end.

lol no seriously. freaking AMAZING...words can't even do the sandwich justice. my sister said i had to order one so i did with extra mustard and it was soooo great. the meat was so tender and juicy and perfectly seasoned mmmmmm....mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm

you have to check this place out you will not be disappointed...omg i'm starving writing all these reviews lol. but seriously CHECK IT OUT!
author: Ashley H.

description:
In my opinion, if this is not the best butcher in town- it is surely in the conversation.  The selection is outstanding, and the quality and 'freshness' of the meats is excellent.  I have shopped here on a spattering of occasions, and I'd say the selections are similar or better to the butchers at Whole Foods, Bryan's, Molly Stones and others.  Most recently I purchased some excellent apple-wood smoked bacon and a meat-sauce (past sauce) made in house.  Both were great.  I had one of their beef jerky pieces as well, and didn't enjoy it, but wouldn't evaluate this place on their jerky!  I'll be back soon for the gorgeous filet mignon I drooled on but didn't purchase on my last visit.  Also curious about their Kobe beef.   Is it real from Japan or 'US Kobe style'?  I'll research this soon too.

Generally speaking, prices are expensive but the value is there...I'll be back soon.
author: Andy S.

description:
Really the best butcher in town. For Thanksgiving I got all the meat I needed here including caul fat. My turkey roulade turned out juicy and yummy. 

A bit spendy but you pay for the great service and the quality meats!
author: Mimi T.

description:
Delicious Italian sausage sandwich.  Sausage is home made and the sandwich was large.  We also had the pastrami sandwich which was quite peppery but very delicious as well.  

They have a large selection of meats for home.  All fresh and ready for home cooking.
author: Lori T.

description:
I personally find this place mediocre with unpleasant help. The Dick behind the counter was more interested in opening his paycheck than helping me. and oh I am sorry for requesting to slice the meat a certain way........... I guess customer service is not in your lexicon.

Pricey and not worth it....
author: David G.

description:
Ehh... First time here. Ordered the hot pastrami. It's just so so.  

I love eating meat but this sandwich needed some help. It was just all meat and bread.
author: Myce X.

description:
Don't be fooled by the rave reviews for chicken pot pie and meatloaf from the lunch counter at Golden Gate Meat Company. On a quest for the best meals in San Francisco, I Googled these two classic comfort foods and arrived at the Ferry Building to see if GGMC actually deserved it's near perfect score of 4.5 out of 5 pts on Yelp.

Sigh.

The pot pies sit all day in a display case, and are served at room temperature, which may not mean much to Brits, but at $7 a pop, and only 5 inches in diameter (think Swanson's pot pie), this Yank expects the filling to be silky smooth and juicy, the meat and vegetables, moist and flavorful, and the crust, the essence of buttery, flaky goodness. Sigh. While the crust may be flaky, it only made the thick, mediocre filling feel that much more gummy in my mouth. I didn't get past two bites before moving on to the mushroom gravy-covered meatloaf, which comes with mash potatoes or grilled fresh vegetables, $8.

Ack!

The meatloaf was a little slice of tender pink flesh reminiscent of canned deviled ham, with an odd, gritty finish, which might explain why it was the size of a biscotti. The sour tasting mushroom sauce suggested wine that was not allowed to cook off completely, thus masking the mushrooms, bits of which relied more on your imagination than plain sight. The only saving grace were the grilled vegetables, delicious onions, green beans, peppers, and broccoli florets seasoned to perfection.

Searching for better?

KFC's Chicken Pot Pie. You heard me. The Colonel gets what makes our mouths dance and drool, in a pie that not only dwarfs GGMC's puny chick-a-don't, at 6 1/2", but comes full of fresh pulled dark meat, silky smooth and plentiful butter yellow gravy, big pieces of carrots and potatoes, peas, and a crispy, toasty, buttery crust that begs to be broken into dipping pieces. $3.99 everyday, dollar off on Mondays. Some stores are better at making these than others, namely the Duboce and 3rd street restaurants, but I daresay you won't find better at any other restaurant in the city.

Max's Opera Cafe meatloaf. Yes, the uber fancy eatery knows from mom's favorite baked meat, serving up an actual loaf the size of a butter pound cake, with surprisingly similar tenderness, and remarkable for it's meaty taste, and excellent color. The mushroom gravy is a shining example of silky brown glazing, full bodied meat flavor, and chock full of sauteed fresh mushrooms. Served with a mound of fresh, chunky mashed potatoes and tender fresh carrots. At $14.95., the portion is so large you should share it, and the restaurant is so beautiful, you'll want to do so with a date. Did I mention it has a full bar?
author: John Z.

description: Solid pot pie - I asked for a chicken pot pie, but I pushed my fork in and discovered that it was actually a beef pot pie that I had been given.  I didn't take it back as I happen to like beef pot pies too, but just a surprise for me as I was expecting a very different flavor.  I will say the beef and the gravy inside had a very nice spicy peppery-ness that I really appreciated, and the crust was sufficiently flaky.  It was very filling (honestly the perfect size for lunch) and not a bad price amongst the shops at the touristy/popular Ferry Building.
author: Grace S.

description:
If you're hungry and need a quick, filling snack. two bucks (tax included) gets you a thick, juicy Italian sausage (regular or spicy) on a stick -- mustard optional. It's one of the best and most filling, gluten-free, low-carb, Paleo-friendly deals in the entire Ferry Building.

Also: They have a large assortment of sugar-free jerkies, including beef, lamb and turkey. 

Oh, and the stuff in the meat counter looks awesome, too. One of these days, I'll buy tons of raw meat, haul it back to my office, cram it in the breakroom fridge and horrify one of my vegan coworkers.
author: Henry F.

description:
This is a tough review for me because I always hate knocking down a good product due to bad service. I actually like the gal who serves up the breakfast sandwiches in the morning but I don't like the guilt trip I get every time I whip out an ATM/Credit card.

Here's the thing. For about a year now, I've purchased tasty breakfast sandwiches at GGMC and in spite of my two star review, I can' t knock their quality. These little morsels are a great way to start my morning, twice a week, when I commute up to Marin.

Here's the catch.

I live in Nob Hill, and my checking account is with Citibank. This means that I have to walk almost a full mile, round trip, to get cash in my wallet without paying 15% on $20 (granted, this goes down if I decide to guzzle $100 at a time). This means that when I haul my a** out the door around 7am, I'm not likely to have a fist full of dead presidents to buy my breakfast with.

I was willing to put up with the dirty looks every time I cost the poor shop owners 2.29% (that's roughly 12 cents) on a credit card transaction first thing in the morning. When I went to pick up my usual breakfast on May 29th, I was told that I would now be billed $6 for my breakfast sandwich due to my use of a card.

Wow, really?

Allow me to clarify something for the management at GGMC.

If I take out cash so that you don't have to spend 11.5 cents extra (how much do those ingredients actually cost you?), it costs me $3 at the local ATM robbery station. I understand that 12 cents is an inconvenient amount to have to spend on the lazy commuters who don't want to spend $3 to give you cash, or walk the extra mile in the morning, but your policy has gone from obnoxious to insulting.

I like your product. I don't have any love left for you. I can just as easily buy my breakfast on the other side of the bay when the ferry pulls into Tiburon. The Servinos own a lovely little cafe at that ferry landing where they don't act like my plastic is going to put them out of business if I patronize their shop with it.
author: Ian A.

description:
This place is the creme de la creme, the upper echelon, the mecca of meat. Okay maybe I'm getting a lil carried away but I'm not boasting when I say this place is pretty incredible. So recently I've gotten into the whole organic food craze and I'm always in search of that perfect organic, grass fed steak. That search has ended here. I've bought meat at other gourmet supermarkets such as Whole Foods, Mollie Stone's, and Draegers....but the fine purveyors of meat at Golden Gate win hands down. 

First off this is the only place in the Bay Area I've seen that actually carry USDA Prime graded beef. Beef that is usually only reserved for restaurants. When I saw it I had an epiphany...to think that an ordinary guy like me can take home such quality meat and prepare it any way I like got me salivating. 

However this high quality does come at a cost $22.95/lb for the ribeye. Bought it today and cooked it up at home the very same day. Was one of the best steaks I've ever had in my life...restaurant or otherwise. Chicken and pork chops looked delicious as well. Can't wait to return and indulge in something else!
author: Derrek O.

description:
Vegetarians turn your heads this is a great little butcher shop in the ferry building. As a lunch spot they have a very decent meatloaf sandwich and really any of their sandwiches are a sure win for carnivores everywhere. 
They now serve breakfast sandwiches and my co-workers along with myself swear this is the best egg mcmuffin knockoff of any place we've tried. 

Best thing I said while taking one of my co-workers here
Them. "Um..what kind of salads do you have"
I look at the cashier and then back at him "She wants me to slap you."
author: Norris T.

description:
Top quality cuts of meat, and a friendly staff who will help you navigate their selection.
I came in the ferry building looking for duck fat to make confit. When I was purchasing the guy who rang me up was helpful in helping me pick out the correct amounts so I didn't wind up with extra.  I like it when a place doesn't try and over-sell you.
Also, he gave me cold-cut samples before I bought stuff for a charcuterie plate.
When you're paying top dollar for quality, it's nice to be able to make sure you're getting exactly what you want.
author: Amy L.

description: Looks like they have a decent lunch menu and a variety of things to try like the pot pie. I tried the kobe beef slider for $5, it was ok. I would liked to have tried the other stuff though.
author: Daniel T.

description:
Being a meat junkie carnivore, this place was a delight. The cuts of meants all look amazing and fresh. I took home some peking duck breast and did a ghetto sous vide with that bad boy, and man it was delicious! So tender and juicy...

I also stopped here a few times for their side lunches and that was pretty tasty too!

Love this place!
author: Anthony N.

description:
4 1/2* Golden Gate Meat Co.
Ferry Bldg
415 9837800
One side is organic & natural meats (on the expensive side, but you get what you pay for)
Other side is takeout food; perfect for light lunch or snack
The chicken vegetable soup was the best
The lamb skewer was fantastic
Friendly service
Seating on butcher side
author: Rosquete B.

description:
Golden Gate Meats have the kind of meat that makes your family & guests take a bite, close their eyes, and smile in pure pleasure. 

But it's not just the meat - I've been coming for three years, almost every Saturday, and in that time have developed deep respect for the family that runs it. Their professionalism and expertise are unmatched, and the service has been incredible. They take the time to help me understand the difference between cuts, and have given me the confidence to experiment. 

From the most basic of weekly chicken dinners to the most elaborate of parties, Golden Gate has been there for me with unfailing good cheer and excellent advice. Some highlights are:

The silky smooth beef tenderloin I served to my new in-laws the first time they came to dinner. Out-of-this-world meatballs with pumpkin that filled the house with a welcoming deliciousness for our son's 3rd birthday. Lamb cuts that impressed a hard-to-impress French chef dining at our house. I could go on and on, but instead, I encourage you to make a visit!
author: Meghan C.

description: Beef pot pie was best I've ever had. Great flavor and crunchy crust. Going back to buy some to take home.
author: Jon O.

description: Very yummy breakfast sandwich and great service. We brought over a croissant from Acme to swap with the bread on their sandwich and they did it for us, so nice. Plus we ordered a spicy sausage on a stick, fun and delicious. And, their breakfast sandwich is a few bucks less than others around!
author: Nicole J.

description:
This place is where you go if you need to buy those Food Network worthy cuts of meat you only see on TV. They do exist! And I know where to find one!

After embarrassing myself by walking around looking for foie gras at grocery stores.... O.o  I was finally directed here where I was drooling on the glass protector betweeen me and the craziest most beautiful cuts of meat I'd ever seen in my life. 

The butchers did not laugh at me for not knowing much about what I was buying as I came in with a recipe to try out.  I felt comfortable talking to them with my Ummms and Uhhhs and left confidently with the cuts I needed. Next time I try to make a 5-star recipe, I know where to buy my goods.
author: Christina S.

description:
So...I only had their hot foods. In fact, I only had the sausage on a stick, $2.00 for a delicious, savory, meaty snack, or quick lunch.  (thanks for the tip, sis..bwahaha that is just dirty) 

Service = friendly and fast. 

We checked out the fresh deli section, and indeed it is pricey but I'm sure it is worth it.  On any other weekend, I would have purchased a few pounds of meaty delight but we were planning to have German for dinner (yeah, already meatville).

Small local businesses, need our support, so every once in a while pop in, get them a try, and maybe you too, will return to buy a nice cut of meat, some sausage or anything else for a nice dinner at home.
author: Fannie S.

description: A breakfast sandwich can't really be all that special, right? Seems like a pretty good rule of thumb. This place is the exception to the rule. Hands down the best breakfast sandwich  I've ever had. I go back every time I'm in town.
author: Robb L.

description: I have eaten a few things here, but the best thing, by far, are the brownies ($2), and the links on a stick (spicy or regular) which I believe are $2.50. Delicious, quick and affordable finger food.
author: Richard V.

description: My wife and I by their steaks for special occasions. It is very pricey but worth every damn penny. Their prime meats are as good as any steak I have ever tasted. Period! Ask for a small side of their rub mixture. Put it on the meat about 10 minutes before you grill the steaks. Epic! I have never tried their sandwiches but after reading the reviews, that's gonna change real quick. Pastrami here I come!!
author: Butch P.

description:
The best HOT pastrami sandwhich everrrrr! They make their own mustard that they put in the sandwich and it is OH so good! 

If you're ever at the Ferry Building looking for something to eat, grab a hot pastrami. You will not be disappointed. Now, if hot pastrami isn't your thing, they have other options to choose from.
author: Monica N.

description:
When I got up to the menu, I took a look and before I could read the whole thing my BF said "You do like pot pies, right?" and then went off to order one. He got us both chicken pot pies and two sausages on a stick (both spicy, though I got mine with mustard).

SO GOOD. The pot pie was a great portion, delicious crust, and the gravy was superb. Not too dense and not too light, it was the perfect blend and well seasoned. And back again to the crust, buttery, flaky, and made it all quite delectable. 

The sausage was just the right blend of spicy and tasted so good. Especially with the mustard.
author: Shauna S.

description:
The hot pastrami sandwich here is quite good. It's very simple: chopped up bits of juicy, fatty, salty pastrami on an Acme french roll spread with some deli mustard.
